meanings.definition: The use of optical illusions or tricks to create a false impression of reality.
meanings.sent1: Magicians often rely on illusionism to entertain audiences with their tricks.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting was full of illusionism, making viewers question what they saw.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to figure out the illusionism in the magic show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an illusionism, hiding the sadness behind a mask of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The illusionism of the mirage in the desert deceived the weary travelers.

meanings.definition: The artistic movement or style that aims to create the illusion of reality in a work of art.
meanings.sent1: Illusionism in paintings can make scenes look incredibly lifelike.
meanings.sent2: During the Renaissance, illusionism was a popular technique among artists.
meanings.sent3: The museum visitors marveled at the illusionism in the 3D artwork.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling had an illusionism that transported listeners to another world.
meanings.sent5: The illusionism in the sculpture made it seem as if the figure would come to life.
